channel.title: Someone help
channel.description: Someone please help me I change my clients ip to my ip nd it still doesn't let me on so it has to be something with the source but idk. I'm hopin one of ya'll have the same problem nd know how to fix it.

item.title: Someone help
item.dc:creator: @w_t_f_betch w t f betch
item.description:
@w_t_f_betch wrote:

LOL Stop bein a post whore, I forgot my computer jumps from optimum wifi nd my wifi…

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help
item.dc:creator: @imstrength imstrength
item.description:
@imstrength wrote:

FIRST, this is the kid telling me to quit because i didnt know what i was doing? and you cant even log onto your server. sweet bro.

[quote=“Tutorial, post:6, topic:464467”][quote author=w t f betch link=topic=568462.msg4126805#msg4126805 date=1350527514]

learn to portforward, please look up a tut its too long to explain
[/quote] I already port foward it

Are you hosting it and you want to get on? Or do you just want to code/play with it? If it’s the second one, change the IP to 127.0.0.1 because it’s local host.

I’m hosting it, I changed my clients Ip to my Ip and it doesn’t let me on or other players on.

You will not be able to connect to your own server if it is hosted on your computer; however, other people should be able to connect as long as your router and your computer firewalls allow incoming connections.[/quote]

this cant be true…? i host via my computer and i can log into it just fine…i have never heard of not being able to on your own computer if you have port forwarded correctly…

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“w t f betch, post:4, topic:464467”][quote author=jwag link=topic=568462.msg4126683#msg4126683 date=1350517404]
learn to portforward, please look up a tut its too long to explain
[/quote] I already port foward it

Are you hosting it and you want to get on? Or do you just want to code/play with it? If it’s the second one, change the IP to 127.0.0.1 because it’s local host.

I’m hosting it, I changed my clients Ip to my Ip and it doesn’t let me on or other players on.[/quote]
You will not be able to connect to your own server if it is hosted on your computer; however, other people should be able to connect as long as your router and your computer firewalls allow incoming connections.

Read full topic

Did you portfoward both your firewall and router?
